thread.title: All new Triumph Bonneville Bobber coming to India by May : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today
thread.title_full: All new Triumph Bonneville Bobber coming to India by May : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today

title: All new Triumph Bonneville Bobber coming to India by May : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today
text:
All new Triumph Bonneville Bobber coming to India by May IndiaToday.in | New Delhi, February 22, 2017 | Written by Pratik Rakshit | UPDATED 16:51 IST The all new Triumph Bonneville Bobber will rival the Harley-Davidson 1200 Custom and Suzuki Intruder M800 in India. 
According to our sources, Triumph India will launch the all new Bonneville Bobber motorcycle in India most likely by May this year. Triumph will also launch the 2017 Street Triple range in India by June. Triumph had unveiled the all new Bonneville Bobber last year in London in a global debut. Triumph Motorcycles already has Thruxton, Thruxton R, T120, T120 Black, T100, T100 Black and the Street Twin. 
Design: 
The Bonneville Bobber introduces a first-in-class riding position, delivered by the beautifully crafted new floating aluminium seat, ergonomically optimised and sculpted for comfort with stitched deep foam pad, and minimal stylish clock - both adjustable to suit rider size and riding style. Combined with a low seat height of 690mm when in the low seat position, the Bonneville Bobber is truly accessible to all riders. Triumph Bonneville Bobber 
Engine: 
Courtesy of the new generation Bonneville HT engine, the Bonneville Bobber delivers category-leading torque for a thrilling hot rod ride and a rich exhaust note. Powered by the critically acclaimed 1200cc high torque engine, as fitted in the Bonneville T120, the all new Bonneville Bobber will be at its peak power at 79bhp and peak torque of 105Nm, with a six-speed gearbox. Triumph Bonneville Bobber 
Features: 
The Bonneville Bobber's features include an authentic battery box with stainless steel strap, bar end mirrors, rear mudguard loop, carb styled twin throttle bodies, broad adjustable levers, traditional rubber gaiters, classic rear 'drum brake' inspired hub, new side panel and sprocket cover with removable inspection cap. Triumph Bonneville Bobber 
Moreover, the Bonneville Bobber features a whole host of premium finishes including bronze 1200HT engine badges and the signature Triumph makers mark triangle, brushed engine covers, branded locking fuel cap and silver satin and graphite handlebar risers. Triumph Bonneville Bobber 
Colors: 
There are four premium colour options to choose from- - Ironstone, Morello Red, Competition Green and Frozen Silver, Jet Black. 
Competition: 
The all new Triumph Bonneville Bobber will rival the Harley-Davidson 1200 Custom and Suzuki Intruder M800 in India. Triumph Bonneville Bobber 
Price: 
We expect the all new Triumph Bonneville Bobber to come for a price tag of Rs 9.5 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi)- Rs 11.5 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi).
